description: An ancient place, cited: BAtlas 3 H3 Phra(da)/Prophthasia/Frakh-kar-Peroz
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: perhaps near Farah AFG

properties.title: OSM location of Farah Bala Hisar

history.comment: added DARMC reference to maintain linkage after retracting less precise location
Location updates and tags from Johan Ahlfeldt's (jahlfeldt) Digital Atlas of the Roman Empire in October 2012
Global migration and reindexing of citations and provenance, February 2012
New locations, coordinates, and metadata from Harvard's DARMC project. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceUpgradesAndMigrations
Detail text updated from former modernLocation. See http://atlantides.org/trac/pleiades/wiki/PlaceDetailsUpgrade

locations.details: A fortified enclosure of mud-brick with the remains of a castle dating from the Timurid (15th-17th c.) period on the site of earlier Achaemenid (6th-4th centuries BC) and Hellenistic (3rd-1st centuries BC) remains.

history.comment: replaced deprecated feature type and set = fort; archaeological remains = substantive
Reimported full way geometry and updated provenance

references.formattedCitation: Afghanistan Signifcant Sites no. 061 Farah Bala Hisar
